subclusters.subcluster_name: Classic Oxidative Damage Accumulation Free Radical Theory
Free Radical Theory of Vascular Aging and Atherosclerosis

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Classic Oxidative Damage Accumulation Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: This theory focuses on accumulation of oxidative damage by ROS causing functional decline and aging, representing the core classic free radical theory.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Tissue-Specific Oxidative Damage Free Radical Theories
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ovarian aging caused by ROS accumulation and antioxidant decline, a tissue-specific application of free radical damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial and Cytoplasmic Superoxide Imbalance Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes superoxide anion imbalance in mitochondria and cytoplasm triggering cellular aging markers, highlighting subcellular ROS imbalance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Vascular Aging and Atherosclerosis
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links free radical oxidative damage to vascular endothelial injury and atherosclerosis, focusing on cardiovascular aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: ROS-Induced Cell Death and Homeostasis Disruption Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS accumulation disrupting cellular homeostasis and triggering programmed cell death pathways in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Metabolic Rate and Oxidative Stress Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Connects metabolic activity, ROS production, and oxidative damage with aging, highlighting metabolic rate’s role in ROS generation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Glutathione Depletion and Redox Imbalance Brain Aging Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-dependent glutathione decline causing redox imbalance, neuroinflammation, and cognitive decline in brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Radical-Mediated Structural Protein Damage Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes hydroxyl radical-mediated oxidative cleavage of cartilage proteoglycans, linking free radicals to structural tissue aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Glutathione Deficiency Brain Aging Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights glutathione decline as a major antioxidant loss driving oxidative stress and brain aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Enzyme Modulation Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on role of antioxidant enzymes like Cu-Zn SOD in scavenging superoxide radicals and influencing lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Spin-Trapping Antioxidant Intervention Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes spin-trap agents quenching free radicals to reduce oxidative damage and extend lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nitric Oxide-Integrated Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Revises classic theory by incorporating beneficial roles of nitric oxide free radicals in vascular aging and systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation Accumulation Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative modifications of proteins, especially carbonylation, accumulating with age and causing functional decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Melatonin Protective Antioxidant Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights melatonin as a free radical scavenger whose decline with age reduces antioxidant defense and promotes aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Damage and Cell Differentiation Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes free radical damage to mtDNA causing bioenergetic decline and senescence, integrating cell differentiation concepts.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Free Radical Theory of Vascular Aging and Atherosclerosis
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on free radical-induced lipid peroxidation and membrane damage promoting atherosclerosis and systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Glutathione Metabolism and Antioxidant Defense Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes role of glutathione metabolism and antioxidant defenses in protecting against ROS and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Uncoupling Protein-Mediated Mitochondrial ROS Control Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on UCPs reducing mitochondrial ROS production and oxidative damage, linking mitochondrial uncoupling to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Lipid Peroxidation Accumulation Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes progressive lipid peroxidation by free radicals as a key mediator of aging-related cellular damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and ROS Accumulation Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS causing mtDNA and protein damage, impairing mitochondrial function and driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Classic Oxidative Damage Accumulation Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes cumulative oxidative damage by free radicals and the role of antioxidant defenses and environmental factors in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Ocular Tissue Free Radical Detoxification Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on enzymatic degradation of free radical detoxification in eye tissues causing oxidative damage and ocular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Selective Protein Oxidative Damage Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights selective oxidative damage to specific proteins causing functional decline and lifespan effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Melanin-Associated Oxidative Stress Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS generated by melanin biosynthesis causing oxidative damage and loss of melanocytes with aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nitric Oxide and Reactive Nitrogen Species Interaction Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes ROS accumulation and interaction with reactive nitrogen species disrupting signaling in cardiovascular aging.
